title: How to Make a Collapsible Chair (for Theatrical Use)

steps.headline: Begin by cutting away bottom braces that hold the front legs to to rear legs, do not discard these pieces.
steps.description: When finished, they should remain the same length as the distance from the front leg to back leg.

steps.headline: Separate seat apparatus from the back portion of the chair.
steps.description: This should leave you with an upside down "L" shape for the front, consisting of front legs and the seat. with an "I" shape representing the back legs and backrest.

steps.headline: Attach crosspiece to the bottom side of the seat.
steps.description: This piece should run from the front of the seat to back of seat, overhanging the back by about 2 to 3 inches (5.1 to 7.6 cm). This crosspiece will support the seat when the weight of the person falls on it during the chairs collapse. Additionally, those 2–3 inches (5.1–7.6 cm) in the back will prevent the seat from collapsing when it is in the upright phase.

steps.headline: Attach hinges to the underside of the two bottom supports that where cut away earlier.
steps.description: These hinges should go at opposite sides of the supports, on the same side, the bottom. Screw the other side of the hinges to the back rest part, roughly where they where earlier.

steps.headline: Repeat step 5, except this time attach the other half of the bottom support hinges to the front legs.
Detach the seat from the front legs.
Attach hinges to the underside of the seat.
steps.description: Strap hinges will usually work best. One on each side of the seat.

steps.headline: Now, attach the other side of the strap hinges to the backside of the front legs.
Finally cut a "U" shaped hole in the backrest's support for the seat roughly the dimensions of the seat support you installed earlier.
steps.description: This should act in a similar way to someone's butt as they sit in an armed chair.

steps.headline: If desired, attach some sort of hardware (shown is a hook &eye) to ensure the chair collapses on when it's supposed to, and not earlier
Sit on the chair, lean forward carefully.
steps.description: The chair should collapse right out from underneath you.

text: Begin by cutting away bottom braces that hold the front legs to to rear legs, do not discard these pieces. When finished, they should remain the same length as the distance from the front leg to back leg. Separate seat apparatus from the back portion of the chair. This should leave you with an upside down "L" shape for the front, consisting of front legs and the seat. with an "I" shape representing the back legs and backrest. Attach crosspiece to the bottom side of the seat. This piece should run from the front of the seat to back of seat, overhanging the back by about 2 to 3 inches (5.1 to 7.6 cm). This crosspiece will support the seat when the weight of the person falls on it during the chairs collapse. Additionally, those 2–3 inches (5.1–7.6 cm) in the back will prevent the seat from collapsing when it is in the upright phase. Attach hinges to the underside of the two bottom supports that where cut away earlier. These hinges should go at opposite sides of the supports, on the same side, the bottom. Screw the other side of the hinges to the back rest part, roughly where they where earlier. Repeat step 5, except this time attach the other half of the bottom support hinges to the front legs.  Detach the seat from the front legs.  Attach hinges to the underside of the seat. Strap hinges will usually work best. One on each side of the seat. Now, attach the other side of the strap hinges to the backside of the front legs.  Finally cut a "U" shaped hole in the backrest's support for the seat roughly the dimensions of the seat support you installed earlier. This should act in a similar way to someone's butt as they sit in an armed chair. If desired, attach some sort of hardware (shown is a hook &eye) to ensure the chair collapses on when it's supposed to, and not earlier  Sit on the chair, lean forward carefully. The chair should collapse right out from underneath you.
